categories.label: Physical-Atmosphere
categories.definition: This category contains vocabulary terms describing physical atmosphere parameters

narrower.label: Air pressure
Pressure (measured variable) exerted by the atmosphere and correction to sea level
narrower.definition: Measurement as a phenomenon (as opposed to a co-ordinate) of the force per unit area exerted by the atmosphere determined in-situ at a known altitude and converted to the value at sea level assuming an isothermal layer.

narrower.label: Pressure (measured variable) exerted by the atmosphere
narrower.definition: Measurement as a phenomenon (as opposed to a co-ordinate) of the force per unit area exerted by the atmosphere determined in-situ at a known altitude.

narrower.label: Visibility
Horizontal visibility in the atmosphere
Present weather in the atmosphere
narrower.definition: Visual observation using WMO code table 4677 or 4501

narrower.label: Air-Sea Fluxes
Net shortwave heat flux
narrower.definition: The net shortwave heat flux is the difference between the downwelling radiation from the sun as modified by the gases and clouds of the atmosphere and the radiation returned from the sea surface, which is either reflected by the surface or backscattered from within the water column.

narrower.label: Net heat flux
narrower.definition: Net surface heat flux across the air-sea interface.

narrower.label: Net mass flux
Downwelling vector irradiance as photons (PAR wavelengths) in the atmosphere
Downwelling vector irradiance as energy (solar (300-3000nm) wavelengths) in the atmosphere
Sensible heat flux
narrower.definition: Heat exchange due to difference in temperature between air and water.

narrower.label: Downwelling vector irradiance as energy in the atmosphere
Latent heat flux
narrower.definition: Heat loss due to evaporation

narrower.label: Sensible heat flux due to precipitation
Net longwave heat flux
narrower.definition: The net longwave heat flux is the net flux of the greybody emissions from the sea surface, cloud layers and the gases of the atmosphere.

narrower.label: Downwelling vector irradiance as energy (longwave) in the atmosphere
UV radiation
Downwelling vector irradiance as energy (ultra-violet wavelengths) in the atmosphere
Humidity
Dew point temperature of the atmosphere
narrower.definition: The temperature to which air must cool to become saturated with water vapour

narrower.label: Specific humidity of the atmosphere
Relative humidity of the atmosphere
narrower.definition: The ratio of the amount of water vapour in the air compared to the maximum amount of water vapour that can theoretically be held at the air's temperature

narrower.label: Wet bulb temperature of the atmosphere
Precipitation and evaporation
Thickness of precipitation amount (liquid water equivalent) in the atmosphere
Precipitation duration (liquid water equivalent) in the atmosphere
Hail duration in the atmosphere
Thickness of hail amount in the atmosphere
Hail intensity in the atmosphere
Precipitation rate (liquid water equivalent) in the atmosphere

categories.label: Chemical
categories.definition: This category contains vocabulary terms describing chemicalparameters

narrower.label: Oxygen
Concentration of oxygen {O2} per unit volume of the water body
narrower.definition: Concentration of dissolved oxygen per unit volume of the water column. Oxygen may be expressed in terms of mass, volume or quantity of substance.

narrower.label: Concentration of oxygen {O2} per unit mass of the water body
narrower.definition: Concentration of dissolved oxygen per unit mass of the water column. Oxygen may be expressed in terms of mass, volume or quantity of substance.

narrower.label: Saturation of oxygen {O2} in the water body [dissolved phase]
Alkalinity
Total alkalinity per unit mass of the water body
narrower.definition: Concentration (moles or mass) of acid-neutralising bases per unit mass of the water column

narrower.label: Concentration of carbonate ions per unit mass of the water body
Suspended particulate material
Concentration of suspended particulate material per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of suspended particulate material (organic) per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of suspended particulate material (inorganic) per unit volume of the water body

categories.label: Biological
categories.definition: This category contains vocabulary terms describing biologicalparameters

narrower.label: Chlorophyll
Concentration of inferred chlorophyll from relative fluorescence per unit mass of the water body
Concentration of inferred chlorophyll from relative fluorescence per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of total chlorophyll-a per unit volume of the water body
narrower.definition: The amount (mass or moles) of the following pigments (divinyl chlorophyll-a, chlorophyll-a, chlorophyllide-a, chlorophyll-a allomers and chlorophyll-a prime) in a known volume of any water body.

narrower.label: Concentration of total chlorophyll-c per unit volume of the water body
narrower.definition: The amount (mass or moles) of the following pigments (chlorophyll-c1, chlorophyll-c2, chlorophyll-c1c2, chlorophyll-c3) in a known volume of any water body.

narrower.label: Concentration of total chlorophyll-a plus chlorophyll-b plus chlorophyll-c per unit volume of the water body
narrower.definition: The amount (mass or moles) of total chlorophyll-a (divinyl chlorophyll-a, chlorophyll-a, chlorophyllide-a, chlorophyll-a allomers and chlorophyll-a prime) plus total chlorophyll-b (divinyl chlorophyll-b, chlorophyll-b) plus total chlorophyll-c (chlorophyll-c1, chlorophyll-c2, chlorophyll-c1c2, chlorophyll-c3) in a known volume of any water body.

narrower.label: Concentration of chlorophyll-b per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of divinyl chlorophyll-b per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of chlorophyll-a per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of chlorophyll-a plus divinyl chlorophyll-a per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of chlorophyll-b plus divinyl chlorophyll-b per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of divinyl chlorophyll-a per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of chlorophyllide-a per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of chlorophyll-c2 per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of chlorophyll-c1 per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of chlorophyll-c1c2 per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of chlorophyll-c3 per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of chlorophyll per unit mass of the water body
narrower.definition: The mass of all types of chlorophyll per unit mass of the water column held in particles of any size

narrower.label: Concentration of chlorophyll per unit volume of the water body
narrower.definition: The mass of all types of chlorophyll per unit volume of the water column held in particles of any size

narrower.label: Fluorescence of the water body
narrower.definition: The amount of radiation generated in the water column in response to higher energy radiation transmission expressed relative to an unspecified baseline

narrower.label: Concentration of total chlorophyll-b per unit volume of the water body
narrower.definition: The amount (mass or moles) of the following pigments (divinyl chlorophyll-b and chlorophyll-b) in a known volume of any water body.

narrower.label: Other Pigment
Light absorption coefficient of dissolved organic matter
narrower.definition: The proportion of the incident light that is absorbed by the dissolved component of a sample from any body of fresh or salt water.

narrower.label: Light absorption coefficient of phytoplankton
narrower.definition: The proportion of the incident light that is absorbed by the algal (phytoplankton) component of a sample from any body of fresh or salt water.

narrower.label: Light absorption coefficient of nonalgal particles
narrower.definition: The proportion of the incident light that is absorbed by the detrital or non-algal component of a sample from any body of fresh or salt water.

narrower.label: Concentration of photoprotective carotenoids per unit volume of the water body
narrower.definition: The amount (mass or moles) of the following pigments (alloxanthin, diadinoxanthin, diatoxanthin, Zeaxanthin, alpha carotene, beta carotene) in a known volume of any water body.

narrower.label: Concentration of photosynthetic carotenoids per unit volume of the water body
narrower.definition: The amount (mass or moles) of the following pigments (19-butanoyloxyfucoxanthin, fucoxanthin, 19-hexanoyloxyfucoxanthin, peridinin) in a known volume of any water body

narrower.label: Concentration of photosynthetic pigments per unit volume of the water body
narrower.definition: The amount (mass or moles) of photosynthetic carotenoids (19-butanoyloxyfucoxanthin, fucoxanthin, 19-hexanoyloxyfucoxanthin, peridinin) plus total chlorophyll-a pigments (divinyl chlorophyll-a, chlorophyll-a, chlorophyllide-a, chlorophyll-a allomers and chlorophyll-a prime) plus total chlorophyll-b pigments (divinyl chlorophyll-b, chlorophyll-b) plus total chlorophyll-c pigments (chlorophyll-c1, chlorophyll-c2, chlorophyll-c1c2, chlorophyll-c3) in a known volume of any water body.

narrower.label: Concentration of total accessory pigments per unit volume of the water body
narrower.definition: The amount (mass or moles) of photosynthetic carotenoids (19-butanoyloxyfucoxanthin, fucoxanthin, 19-hexanoyloxyfucoxanthin, peridinin) plus photoprotective carotenoids (alloxanthin, diadinoxanthin, diatoxanthin, Zeaxanthin, alpha carotene, beta carotene) plus total chlorophyll-b pigments (divinyl chlorophyll-b, chlorophyll-b) plus total chlorophyll-c pigments (chlorophyll-c1, chlorophyll-c2, chlorophyll-c1c2, chlorophyll-c3) in a known volume of any water body.

narrower.label: Concentration of total pigment per unit volume of the water body
narrower.definition: The amount (mass or moles) of all pigments in a known volume of any water body

narrower.label: Concentration of total diagnostic pigments per unit volume of the water body
narrower.definition: The amount (mass or moles) of photosynthetic carotenoids (19-butanoyloxyfucoxanthin, fucoxanthin, 19-hexanoyloxyfucoxanthin, peridinin) plus total chlorophyll-b pigments (divinyl chlorophyll-b, chlorophyll-b) plus alloxanthin and zeaxanthin in a known volume of any water body.

narrower.label: Concentration of echinenone per unit mass of the water body
narrower.definition: The amount (mass or moles) of the specified pigment determined by HPLC assay of a sample collected by dissolution in acteone of the residue collected by GF/F filtration of a known volume of any water body. The quoted value either results from a single determination or the average of replicate determinations

narrower.label: Concentration of antheraxanthin per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of canthaxanthin per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of lutein per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of neoxanthin per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of prasinoxanthin per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of violaxanthin per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of astaxanthin per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of dinoxanthin per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of diatoxanthin per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of zeaxanthin per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of lycopene per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of diadinoxanthin per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of gyroxanthin diester per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of diadinochrome per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of 19-hexanoyloxyfucoxanthin per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of pheophytin-a per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of pheophytin-b per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of pyropheophytin-a per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of pyropheophorbide-a per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of pheophorbide-a per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of 19-butanoyloxyfucoxanthin per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of 4-keto-19-hexanoyloxyfucoxanthin per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of alpha-carotene per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of beta-carotene per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of alpha-carotene and beta-carotene per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of Mg-2,4-divinyl pheoporphyrin a5 monomethyl ester per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of alloxanthin per unit volume of the water body
narrower.definition: Concentration of the carotenoid pigment alloxanthin per unit volume of a water body.  The pigment is contained in suspended particles of unspecified size

narrower.label: Concentration of fucoxanthin per unit volume of the water body
narrower.definition: Concentration of the carotenoid pigment fucoxanthin per unit volume of a water body.  The pigment is contained in suspended particles of unspecified size

narrower.label: Concentration of peridinin per unit volume of the water body
narrower.definition: Concentration of the carotenoid pigment peridinin per unit volume of a water body.  The pigment is contained in suspended particles of unspecified size

narrower.label: Concentration of phycoerythrin per unit volume of the water body
Ocean Biota
Biovolume
narrower.definition: The volume of a biological object described elsewhere in the metadata (e.g.: single-species populations, all species within a phytoplankton sample â€¦) occurring in a given volume of water.

narrower.label: Mean unit biovolume
narrower.definition: The average volume of individual organisms (cells or colonies).

narrower.label: Phytoplankton Colour Index
Abundance of biota
narrower.definition: The relative representation of flora and fauna in a particular sample or region.

narrower.label: Biotic taxonomic identification
narrower.definition: The identification of the biotic elements to the relevant scientific classification group (taxa), e.g. genus or species.

narrower.label: Dry weight biomass per unit volume of the water body
Wet weight biomass per unit volume of the water body
Detection of acoustic tag
Suspended particulate material
Concentration of suspended particulate material per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of suspended particulate material (organic) per unit volume of the water body
Concentration of suspended particulate material (inorganic) per unit volume of the water body

categories.label: Physical-Water
categories.definition: This category contains vocabulary terms describing physical water parameters

narrower.label: Bathymetry
Sea-floor depth below surface of the water body
Height above surface of the water body
narrower.definition: Surface references mean sea level, which means the time mean of sea surface elevation at a given location over an arbitrary period sufficient to eliminate the tidal signals.

narrower.label: Wave
Spectral significant height of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: Significant wave height approximated as four times the square root of the first moment of the wave power spectrum.

narrower.label: Period at the peak spectral energy of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: Period of the peak of the energy spectrum analysed by spectral method.

narrower.label: Direction at spectral maximum of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: Direction (related to true north) from which the peak period waves are coming from analysed by spectral method.

narrower.label: Significant height of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The average height of the highest one third of the waves, where the height is defined as the vertical distance from a wave trough to the following wave crest.

narrower.label: Average height of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The mean height of waves on the water body analysed by zero crossing method.

narrower.label: Root mean square height of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The root mean square wave height analysed by zero crossing method.

narrower.label: Average height of the highest 1/10th of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The mean of the highest ten per cent of trough to crest distances measured during the observation period.

narrower.label: Average zero crossing period of the highest 1/3rd of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The average period of the highest 1/3 of waves measured during a recording burst

narrower.label: Maximum height of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The maximum vertical distance between a wave crest and the immediately preceding or following through during a specified observation period.

narrower.label: Directional spreading of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: Sea surface wave mean directional spread analysed by spectral method.

narrower.label: Period of swell waves on the water body
narrower.definition: Period between successive swell maxima.

narrower.label: Average crest period of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: Sea surface wave mean crest period analysed by zero crossing method.

narrower.label: Direction of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: Direction from which waves are coming relative to True North.

narrower.label: Significant height of swell waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The average height of the highest one third of the swell waves, where the height is defined as the vertical distance from a wave trough to the following wave crest.

narrower.label: Period at spectral maximum of swell waves first component on the water body
narrower.definition: Period of the highest swell wave peak analysed by spectral method.

narrower.label: Direction at spectral maximum of swell waves first component on the water body
narrower.definition: Direction from which the most energetic waves are coming in the swell wave component of a sea.

narrower.label: Significant height of wind sea waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The average height of the highest one third of the wind sea waves, where the height is defined as the vertical distance from a wave trough to the following wave crest.

narrower.label: Period at spectral maximum of wind sea waves on the water body
narrower.definition: Period of the highest wind sea wave peak analysed by spectral method.

narrower.label: Direction at spectral maximum of wind sea waves on the water body
narrower.definition: Direction (related to true north) from which the peak period wind sea waves are coming from analysed by spectral method.

narrower.label: Maximum zero crossing period of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The maximum period of the waves analysed by zero crossing method.

narrower.label: Average height of the highest 1/3rd of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The mean of the highest third of waves on the water body analysed by zero crossing method.

narrower.label: Average zero crossing period of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The period of the significant wave analysed by zero crossing method.

narrower.label: Average zero crossing period of the highest 1/10th waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The average period of the highest tenth of waves measured during a recording burst.

narrower.label: Variance spectral density of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: Fourier Analysis on directional sea level elevation, also named 'Directional Spectral density' or 'Directional Power spectral density'.

narrower.label: Directional variance spectral density of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: Sea surface wave directional variance spectral density is the variance of the amplitude of the waves within given ranges of direction and wave frequency.

narrower.label: Period at second highest energy spectrum peak of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: Period of the second highest peak of the energy spectrum analysed by spectral method.

narrower.label: Zeroth spectral moment of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The variance spectral density of the zeroth frequency moment.

narrower.label: Direction of wind sea waves on the water body
narrower.definition: Direction from which wind sea waves are coming relative to True North.

narrower.label: Spectral directional spread of wave peak on the water body
narrower.definition: Sea surface wave peak directional spread analysed by spectral method.

narrower.label: Period of the highest wave on the water body
narrower.definition: Period corresponding to the wave with maximum height in the record analysed by zero crossing method.

narrower.label: Mean period at spectral second frequency moment of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The square root of ratio of the zeroth and second-order moment of the non-directional wave spectrum analysed by spectral method.

narrower.label: Mean period at spectral first frequency moment of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The square root of ratio of the zeroth and first-order moment of the non-directional wave spectrum analysed by spectral method.

narrower.label: Average direction at spectral maximum of waves on the water body
narrower.definition: Average direction (related to true north) from which the peak period waves are coming from analysed by spectral method.

narrower.label: Direction at spectral maximum of swell waves on the water body
narrower.definition: Direction (related to true north) towards which the peak period swell waves are heading, analysed by spectral method.

narrower.label: Wavelength at spectral maximum of swell waves on the water body
narrower.definition: The wavelength of the peak period swell waves analysed by spectral method. The wavelength is the horizontal distance between repeated features on the waveform such as crests, troughs or upward passes through the mean level.

narrower.label: Density
Density of the water body
Water pressure
Pressure (measured variable) in the water body exerted by overlying sea water and any medium above it
narrower.definition: The force per unit area exerted by the overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present on a sensor located in the water column.

narrower.label: Pressure (measured variable) in the water body exerted by overlying sea water only
narrower.definition: The force per unit area exerted by the overlying sea water on a sensor located in the water column. Excludes the pressure due to sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.

narrower.label: Pressure (measured variable) exerted by the atmosphere
narrower.definition: Measurement as a phenomenon (as opposed to a co-ordinate) of the force per unit area exerted by the atmosphere determined in-situ at a known altitude.

narrower.label: Turbidity
Turbidity of the water body
narrower.definition: Estimate of suspended sediment concentration based on the proportion of a light transmission in the water column that is reflected back to a co-located receiver.

narrower.label: Current
Current speed in the water body
narrower.definition: The speed of Eulerian flow in the water column

narrower.label: Eastward geostrophic current velocity in the water body
Northward geostrophic current velocity in the water body
Current direction in the water body
narrower.definition: The direction towards which Eulerian current in the water column is flowing.

narrower.label: Eastward current velocity in the water body
narrower.definition: Speed of Eulerian current flow towards due east.

narrower.label: Northward current velocity in the water body
narrower.definition: Speed of Eulerian current flow towards true north

narrower.label: Upward current velocity in the water body
Air-Sea Fluxes
Net shortwave heat flux
narrower.definition: The net shortwave heat flux is the difference between the downwelling radiation from the sun as modified by the gases and clouds of the atmosphere and the radiation returned from the sea surface, which is either reflected by the surface or backscattered from within the water column.

narrower.label: Net heat flux
narrower.definition: Net surface heat flux across the air-sea interface.

narrower.label: Net mass flux
Downwelling vector irradiance as photons (PAR wavelengths) in the atmosphere
Downwelling vector irradiance as energy (solar (300-3000nm) wavelengths) in the atmosphere
Sensible heat flux
narrower.definition: Heat exchange due to difference in temperature between air and water.

narrower.label: Downwelling vector irradiance as energy in the atmosphere
Latent heat flux
narrower.definition: Heat loss due to evaporation

narrower.label: Sensible heat flux due to precipitation
Net longwave heat flux
narrower.definition: The net longwave heat flux is the net flux of the greybody emissions from the sea surface, cloud layers and the gases of the atmosphere.

narrower.label: Downwelling vector irradiance as energy (longwave) in the atmosphere
Optical properties
Light absorption coefficient of dissolved organic matter
narrower.definition: The proportion of the incident light that is absorbed by the dissolved component of a sample from any body of fresh or salt water.

narrower.label: Light absorption coefficient of phytoplankton
narrower.definition: The proportion of the incident light that is absorbed by the algal (phytoplankton) component of a sample from any body of fresh or salt water.

narrower.label: Light absorption coefficient of nonalgal particles
narrower.definition: The proportion of the incident light that is absorbed by the detrital or non-algal component of a sample from any body of fresh or salt water.

narrower.label: Light extinction coefficient (490nm wavelength) in the water body
narrower.definition: Light extinction coefficient (490nm wavelength) in the water body by radiometer and computation from variation of light intensity with depth.

narrower.label: Downwelling vector irradiance as photons (PAR wavelengths) in the water body
Colored Dissolved Organic Matter
narrower.definition: The amount of colored organic compounds (sometimes called yellow substance or gelbstoff) dissolved in a specified amount of water from any body of fresh or salt water

narrower.label: Water-leaving radiance from the water body
Water-leaving radiance from the water body corrected for viewing angle dependance
Normalised water-leaving radiance from the water body determined from Lw
Normalised water-leaving radiance from the water body determined from Lw_Q
Downwelling vector irradiance as energy in the water body
Sky radiance as energy in the atmosphere
Upwelling radiance as energy in the atmosphere
Secchi depth
narrower.definition: Estimate of the transparency of the surface water based upon the distance below the ship at which a standard black and white disk becomes visible.

narrower.label: Total absorption coefficient in the water body
narrower.definition: Inherent optical property of natural waters. Describes the intensity loss of a light beam through a unit volume of water due to absorption.

narrower.label: Total attenuation coefficient in the water body
narrower.definition: Inherent optical property of natural waters. Describes the intensity loss of a light beam through a unit volume of water due to scattering and absorption.

narrower.label: Total backscattering coefficient in the water body
narrower.definition: Inherent optical property of natural waters. Describes the reflection of light from a unit volume of water back to the incident direction. Integral of the volume scattering function in the backward direction from 90 to 180 degrees.

narrower.label: Particle backscattering coefficient in the water body
narrower.definition: Inherent optical property of natural waters. Describes the reflection of light by particles from a unit volume of water back to the incident direction. Integral of the particle volume scattering function in the backward direction from 90 to 180 degrees.

narrower.label: Total volume scattering function in the water body
narrower.definition: Inherent optical property of natural waters. Describes the angular dependence of scattered light from an incident light beam.

narrower.label: Particle volume scattering function in the water body
narrower.definition: Inherent optical property of natural waters. Describes the angular dependence of scattered light by particles from an incident light beam.

narrower.label: Backscattering
Temperature
Temperature anomaly of the water body
Ocean heat content
Skin temperature of the water body
narrower.definition: Skin temperature of the water body measure by Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer (AVHRR)

narrower.label: Temperature of the water body
narrower.definition: The degree of hotness of the water column expressed against a standard scale.  Includes both IPTS-68 and ITS-90 scales.

narrower.label: Acoustics
Acoustic signal return amplitude from the water body
Sound recorded in the water body
Volume backscattering coefficient
narrower.definition: Echosounder provides two basic measurements: (1) the time delay between transmission of a sound pulse and reception of a return echo from an acoustic target (for example fish), and (2) the intensity of the returning echo. The intensity of returning echo from the fish is dependent on the intensity of sound transmitted by the echosounder, the loss of intensity as the sound wave travels through water (both to the fish and back to the echosounder), and the backscattering cross-section (or target strength) of the fish. Backscattering cross-section determines what proportion of incident sound intensity is reflected from the fish, back to the echosounder. The derived parameter â€˜volume backscattering coefficientâ€™ is the summation of backscattering cross-section from all acoustic targets present within the sampling volume scaled to 1 m3.

narrower.label: Sound velocity in the water body
narrower.definition: The rate at which sound travels through the water column

narrower.label: Salinity
Practical salinity anomaly of the water body
Specific electrical conductivity of the water body
narrower.definition: Conductance is a temperature corrected value, and approximates what the AC (Actual Conductivity) of a solution would be at 25 degrees Celsisus.

narrower.label: Electrical conductivity of the water body
Practical salinity of the water body
narrower.definition: The quantity of dissolved ions (predominantly salt in seawater) expressed on a scale (PSS-78) based on the conductivity ratio of a seawater sample to a standard KCl solution.

categories.label: Sea surface height
categories.definition: This category contains vocabulary terms describing sea surface height parameters

categories.label: Depth
categories.definition: This category contains vocabulary terms describing depth parameters

categories.label: Wind
categories.definition: This category contains vocabulary terms describing wind parameters

categories.label: Air temperature
categories.definition: This category contains vocabulary terms describing air temperature parameters

categories.label: Humidity
categories.definition: This category contains vocabulary terms describing atmospheric humidity parameters

categories.label: Precipitation and evaporation
categories.definition: This category contains vocabulary terms describing precipitation and evaporation parameters

categories.label: Bathymetry
categories.definition: This category contains vocabulary terms describing bathymetry parameters
